means: 不舒服的，被强迫的，拘泥的
强迫( constrain的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: These will be very constrained budgets designed to get the deficit down.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些预算旨在减少赤字，将会大大受限。

sentence.Network_en: Women are too often constrained by family commitments and by low expectations.
sentence.Network_cn: 女性往往受到家庭责任和低期望值的束缚。

sentence.Network_en: For some reason he felt constrained to lower his voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 不知怎么的，他觉得自己必须得压低声音。

entry.def: To constrain someone or something means to limit their development or force them to behave in a particular way.

example.ex: Women are too often constrained by family commitments and by low expectations...
example.tran: 女性往往受到家庭责任和低期望值的束缚。

example.ex: How can we produce top-class engineers when universities are constrained to offer salaries that can only attract mediocre staff?...
example.tran: 大学的财力有限，提供的薪酬仅能吸引水平一般的教师，在这种情况下，我们如何能培养出一流的工程师？

entry.def: If you feel constrained to do something, you feel that you must do it, even though you would prefer not to.

example.ex: For some reason he felt constrained to lower his voice.
example.tran: 不知怎么的，他觉得自己必须得压低声音。

auth_sentence.content: People of faith are not constrained by the law.
auth_sentence.res_content: People of faith are not constrained by the law.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: People of faith are not constrained by the law.

auth_sentence.content: Then I started to feel a little bit constrained.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then I started to feel a little bit constrained.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then I started to feel a little bit constrained.

auth_sentence.content: The season constrained them to carry on the harvest.
auth_sentence.res_content: The season constrained them to carry on the harvest.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The season constrained them to carry on the harvest.
